oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Old Transfer Station Site at 4th Avenue and Charlotte, City Beautiful Scrapbooks, 1958, Vol. 1 p.58
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of the site of the old Nashville Transfer Station at 4th Avenue North and Charlotte Avenue, May 1958. The building was eventually replaced by a parking garage for Commerce Union Bank. Taken by the City Beautiful Commission of Nashville, Tennessee, 1958. The City Beautiful Commission was established by the Mayor and City Council in June of 1953, for the purpose of improving the sanitation, cleanliness, and overall appearance of the City of Nashville. The Commission later became a division of Metro Parks in 1975, and then a part of the Metro Public Works division in 2005. Forms part of the City Beautiful Commission Scrapbook Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
